question.text: Which of the following is the correct order in evolutionary history of man?

options.text: Homo habilis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Homo erectus  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Cromagnon man  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Neanderthal man
Cromagnon man  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Neanderthal man  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Homo erectus  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Homo habilis
Homo erectus  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Homo habilis  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Neanderthal man  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Cromagnon man
Homo habilis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Homo erectus  <math><mo>→</mo></math> Neanderthal man <math><mo>→</mo></math> Cromagnon man

solution.text: The correct order in evolutionary history of human is as follows: Homo habilis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Homo erectus <math><mo>→</mo></math> Neanderthal man <math><mo>→</mo></math> Cromagnon man. The first human like being the hominid was Homo habilis, probably did not eat meat.
